metadata.title: CVE-2019-11023 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
The agroot() function in cgraph\obj.c in libcgraph.a in Graphviz 2.39.20160612.1140 has a NULL pointer dereference, as demonstrated by graphml2gv.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphviz - 2.42.2-7
libcdt5 - 2.42.2-7
libcgraph6 - 2.42.2-7
libgv-guile - 2.42.2-7
libgv-lua - 2.42.2-7
libgv-perl - 2.42.2-7
libgv-ruby - 2.42.2-7
libgv-tcl - 2.42.2-7
libgvc6 - 2.42.2-7
libgvc6-plugins-gtk - 2.42.2-7
libgvpr2 - 2.42.2-7
liblab-gamut1 - 2.42.2-7
libpathplan4 - 2.42.2-7
libxdot4 - 2.42.2-7
python3-gv - 2.42.2-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphviz package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.42.2-7').
